perturbation.original_text: "CONTENT"          means real-time economic news including articles, reports,                    data, information and such materials that have or have been                    and/or will be published from time to time and that is or                    will be in the possession or control of CEIS from time to                    time, in respect of the subject matters as more particularly                    described in Schedule 1;
perturbation.changed_text: "CONTENT"          means real-time economic news including articles, reports,                    data, information and such materials that have or have been                    and/or will be published from time to time and that is or                    will be in the possession or control of CEIS from time to                    time, in respect of the subject matters as CEIS defines it, and nothing in Schedule 1 limits this definition;
perturbation.explanation: By adding that the 'subject matters as CEIS defines it', this creates ambiguity and allows CEIS to unilaterally alter the scope of 'Content' beyond what is detailed in Schedule 1. This undermines the purpose of Schedule 1, which is to provide a clear and agreed-upon description of the Content. This shift contradicts the contractual intent to define 'Content' with specificity, making the contract's scope uncertain and potentially unenforceable.

perturbation.original_text: 2.4  All Intellectual Property Rights and other proprietary rights in any      translated, amended, revised or updated Content independently created by      XFN ("AMENDED CONTENT") shall automatically vest in XFN.
perturbation.changed_text: 2.4  All Intellectual Property Rights and other proprietary rights in any      translated, amended, revised or updated Content independently created by      XFN ("AMENDED CONTENT") shall automatically vest in CEIS.
perturbation.explanation: By changing the rights to vest to CEIS, XFN has no rights to what they created. This goes against common legal understandings of intellectual property ownership of derivative works, creating a contradiction. This shift contradicts intellectual property law and makes the contract's enforcement uncertain.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Intellectual Property Law - Ownership of Derivative Works

perturbation.original_text: 16.1 The English language version shall prevail in the event of any discrepancy      between the interpretation of the English and the Chinese versions of this      Agreement. This Agreement is governed by and shall be construed in      accordance with the laws of Hong Kong
perturbation.changed_text: 16.1 The Chinese language version shall prevail in the event of any discrepancy      between the interpretation of the English and the Chinese versions of this      Agreement. This Agreement is governed by and shall be construed in      accordance with the laws of Beijing
perturbation.explanation: The change stipulates that the Chinese language version of the agreement prevails over the English version. If there were a conflict between the English and Chinese versions of the contract, the Chinese language version will be followed and the contract is now governed by the laws of Beijing, creating ambiguity and uncertainty in legal interpretation and application. The change of jurisdiction from Hong Kong to Beijing introduces a further layer of contradiction and potential unenforceability, as the contract was initially drafted under the legal framework of Hong Kong.
